weather_report:
In Evanston, Illinois, the evening is characterized by a brisk chill as temperatures settle into the low 40s, accompanied by a thick veil of clouds that masks the night sky. The atmosphere is notably blustery, with winds whipping out of the north at a strong pace, creating a sense of urgency in the air. Throughout the night, residents can expect a chance of rain showers, with conditions remaining overcast but potentially clearing somewhat. As the clock ticks forward, temperatures may dip to the low 30s, before gradually rising again overnight to around 33 degrees, mingling with that sharp wind for an added bite.

Thanksgiving Day promises a transition to more sunshine, presenting a canvas of blue above, even as the high hovers around the mid 30s, which is typical for this time of year in the region. Those brave enough to venture outdoors will encounter a symphony of crashing waves, a reflection of the unsettled weather pattern yet continued coastal allure. With the chill settling in, warm layers are suggested—think cozy sweaters and sturdy jackets, perfect for braving the elements. Given these conditions, indoor activities might be preferable, but if one finds themselves outside, a brisk walk along the shoreline could provide a refreshing, albeit chilly, experience under the vast, open sky.
